steps.title: Landing on the app
details: User opens browser and navigates to https://invoify.vercel.app/en.
Page loads and redirects automatically to the dashboard view ("Actions" heading visible).

steps.title: Visual confirmation of brand
details: User scans header and confirms the Invoify logo is visible.

steps.title: Entering sender (Bill-From) name
details: Clicks into the Name field, types “zeeshan”.
Looks at Live Preview ➜ name appears under sender name (small retry needed before it rendered).

steps.title: Entering sender (Bill-From) address
details: User focuses the Address field, types “street 123”.
Checks Live Preview ➜ address appears below Invoice # title (again a brief validation retry).

emotional_arc: Starts curious and hopeful ➜ page load is on the slower side but still acceptable, confidence grows once dashboard appears ➜ small moment of doubt when Live Preview does not update instantly (retry) ➜ relief as info shows correctly ➜ ends feeling satisfied that inputs reflect in preview, overall positive but notices slight sluggishness.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Delayed updates make users wonder if the form worked, eroding confidence.
next_actions: Debounce less aggressively or optimise state propagation so preview updates within 100 ms.
Add subtle spinner or ‘Updating…’ micro-copy while preview refreshes.
Include success animation (e.g., fade-in) to reassure users.

qualitative_opportunities.area: Initial page load (7-10 s in tests)
qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: First impressions set the tone; long loads risk abandonment.
next_actions: Serve critical CSS inline and defer non-critical resources.
Add skeleton loaders to communicate progress.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Clear affordances reduce cognitive load, especially for first-time users.
next_actions: Highlight focused input with stronger outline/contrast.
Provide placeholder examples (e.g., “Acme Corp.”, “123 Main St”).
Validate on blur and surface inline error/help text.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Users scan forms; distinct headings speed comprehension.
next_actions: Make “Bill From”, “Bill To”, etc., visually stronger (font-size, spacing).
Pin section headers so they remain visible when scrolling long forms.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Improves usability for screen-reader users and overall SEO.
next_actions: Ensure inputs have associated <label> elements (not just placeholders).
Add aria-live="polite" region to the preview so screen-readers announce updates.
Check colour contrast for input borders, text and logo.

first_tackles.description: Speed up Live Preview updates or at least show an ‘Updating…’ indicator to remove uncertainty.
Introduce lightweight skeleton loaders during initial page load to make 7-10 s wait feel faster.
Enhance field focus styling and add realistic placeholders for Name and Address to guide users.
Strengthen section headings (‘Bill From’, etc.) for quicker scanning and reduced form fatigue.
Add aria-live region to preview for accessibility; quick code change, high inclusivity impact.
